value:
List of five arias with composers, singers, key and instrumentation, three of them sung in the 1736 revival of Poro (HWV 28).
Holograph manuscript in ink.
Watermark p. 35-42: "LVG" below fleur de lis over Strasbourg bend; countermark: "IV" (Burrows C40)
Contents:
p. 89: [notes on the insertion of five additional arias into Poro] : Aria 1. Tiranna tu vidi allora che uccidi ... dal Sigr. Gio. Alberto Ristora (Dresda) [from the opera Le Fate, 1736] ward gegeben bey Sigr. Anibali in Poro. ex B ... ; Aria 2. Mira virtù che troppo ... dal dito [from the opera Le Fate, 1736] dito in Poro im ??? Act. ex E[?] ... ; Aria 3. Per l'Africane arene leone ... dal Sigre. Leonardo Vinci [from the opera Flavio Anicio Olibrio, 1728] cantata da Antonio Bernacchi, ward gegeben bey Domenico Annibale in Poro im dritten Act, ex F dur ... ; Aria 4. Che furia che mostro ... del Sigre. Hasse ward gesungen von Sigra Merighi in der Opera Siroe in Haymarket, ex D dis ... ; Aria 5. Quel Pastor che ... dal Sigr. Gio. Alberto Ristori ward gegeben von Sigr Annibali in der Opera Didone [1737] im Anfang des 3 Acts. ex A♯ ... -- p. 90. [Further notes on some of these arias, including musical excerpts from] Tiranna tu vidi ; Mira virtù ; Per 'Africane -- p. 91. [Incipit of] Che furia che mostro dal Sigr. Hasse. -- p. 92. [2 feint pencil sketches in the bass clef, one of 10 bars in F major, the other of 2 bars in D minor : for full transcription of these see Burrows & Ronish. A catalogue of Handel's musical autographs (Oxford, 1994), p. 313]

1.1.1 b [Sketch] F F-4 bB {8,F,,FF}4F8-/{,BG'C}4.,A8-/{FDG}4E8A/ ? 2.1.1 b [Sketch] d F-4 bB {8,DFA}{FDE}/4F8G{xCAG}/ ?
[List of five arias, possibly related to the revival of Poro in 1736] ; [and 2 sketches] / [George Frideric Handel]
